title.narrative: SUPPORT TO INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Existence of tested mechanisms for implementation of inclusive practices and trained professionals to support inclusive education in kindergartens and schools, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged, are in school and benefit from improved inclusive, gender-responsive educational policies and practices

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Capacity and Skills Development for social and behaviour change
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Existence of tested mechanisms for implementation of inclusive practices and trained professionals to support inclusive educationin kindergartens and schools

description.narrative: UNICEF engaged more intensively in assistive technologies for children with disabilities by developing an interactive and accessible online platform with resources that are tailored to the needs of children with disabilities and by building the capacities of professionals, incl. through evidence generation and awareness activities, on alternative and augmentative communication. ;Promotion of early inclusive practices is continued by documenting UNICEF and MoES experience and by expanding it to 30 new kindergartens under the pilot EU Child Guarantee project. A total of 44 refugee and migrant girls and 43 boys were supported for distance learning and participated in life skills sessions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2021
